message.content:
cs.LO, cs.PL, cs.FL, cs.AI, cs.DS

Reasoning: The paper deals with the decidability and expressiveness of an extension of $\mtl$ with rational expression guarded modality. This involves studying the automaton-logic connection and temporal projections, which are techniques commonly used in the areas of logic and automata theory. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science). The paper also deals with the satisfiability of the extension, which involves algorithmic and computational complexity considerations, making cs.PL (Programming Languages) and cs.FL (Formal Languages and Automata Theory) likely sub-categories as well. The paper also discusses the expressiveness of the extension, which involves the ability to capture certain properties of systems, making cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with the subclass of the extension where only star-free rational expressions are allowed, which involves the study of regular languages and their properties, making cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) a possible sub-category as well.
